The trauayled pylgrime bringing newes from all partes of the worlde, such like scarce harde of before. Seene and allowed according to the order appointed. Chevalier délibéré. English La Marche, Olivier de, ca. 1426-1502. Batman, Stephen, d. 1584.
[104] p. : ill.
By Henrie Denham, dwelling in Pater-noster rowe, at the signe of the starre], [Imprinted at London : Anno Domini. 1569.
A verse translation of: La Marche, Olivier de. Le chevalier délibéré. Translator's dedication signed: S.B., i.e. Stephen Batman. Printer's name and address from colophon. Signatures: A-N⁴. Running title reads: The trauailed pilgrime. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

[104] p. : ill.
By Henrie Denham, dwelling in Pater-noster rowe, at the signe of the starre], [Imprinted at London : Anno Domini. 1569.
A verse translation of: La Marche, Olivier de. Le chevalier délibéré. Translator's dedication signed: S.B., i.e. Stephen Batman. Printer's name and address from colophon. Signatures: A-N⁴.
